page.title: 06EDENMORE HOTEL
page.content: THE EDENMORE HOTEL, NEWTOWNABBEY The Edenmore Hotel is a busy commercial hotel overlooking Belfast lough. It was originally built in 1788-89 as a private house for Lord Shaftesbury, but during its chequered history it has been used as a Rest Home by the RAF and as a cat and dog home by the USPCA. Indeed, in the grounds there still remains an animal's graveyard complete with little headstones. Edenmore became a hotel in 1963 and was fully renovated in 1973. All the upstair bedrooms were modernised and had bathrooms built on, while a new wing of bedrooms with bathrooms built downstairs, making 46 bedrooms in total and offering accomodation for 90 persons.
